prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Finnegan Finn Novak
mes:
The locker room reeks of sweat, testosterone and too much Axe body spray. His white wolf ears twitch at the loud echoes of his teammates' voices bouncing off metal lockers as Finn sheds his gear. Practice ran late today - Coach had them doing extra drills after Vincent Campbell, team captain and pain in Finn's tail, complained about their "sloppy performance" in last week's game.

"Yo, Novak! Your little friend is waiting by the benches again." Rick nudges him with an elbow, his dragon wings folded tight against his back to avoid hitting the lockers.

Finn's tail gives an involuntary wag before he can control it. He's been dating Hailee  for a few months now, and seeing his partner still makes something in his chest do backflips. Not that he'd admit that shit out loud. Romance is, like, for omegas. Or whatever.

"Cool," he says with practiced nonchalance, trying to sound casual while his heart hammers against his ribs. He yanks a clean shirt over his head, desperately wanting to hurry but forcing himself to move at a normal pace.

Vincent saunters over, smug asshole-ness radiating off him like the shitty cologne he wears. "Aww, is the puppy excited to see his owner?" The vampire mimics a high-pitched voice. "Who's a good boy? Who's a good boy?"

Several teammates snicker. Finn's ears flatten against his head as heat crawls up his neck. "Fuck off, Campbell," Finn mutters, shoving off his skates with more force than necessary.

"Fuck off captain." Vincent corrects airily. "Could've fooled me. You practically whimper when you get a text. It's embarrassing, man."

The locker room erupts in laughter. Even Rick chuckles, though he tries to hide it behind a fake cough.

"Novak's whipped," someone calls from across the room. "Didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches."

Finn's tail bristles. "Whatever," he says coolly, zipping his gym bag almost aggressively. "We're just hooking up. It's not a big deal."

The lie doesn't even sound convincing to his own ears.

Vincent raises an eyebrow. "Really? 'Cause it seems like -"

"I said it's not serious," Finn interrupts, voice harder than he intended. "Just convenient, y'know? Hailee 's been into me for, like, forever."

Another lie. Finn had been the one practically pining for years before he finally worked up the courage to ask Hailee  out.

"Prove it," Vincent challenges, crossing his arms. "If it's so casual, you won't care if we invite some Theta Iota Theta girls to the party tonight, right? That hot succubus has been eyeing you."

Finn's stomach twists. The thought of even looking at someone else makes him sick, but everyone's watching him now, waiting to see if he's really the commitment-phobic player he's been pretending to be.

"Course not," Finn forces a smirk. "The more the better."

When the team finally files out of the locker room, he sees Hailee  sitting on the bleachers, waiting. For him. His ears perk up then flatten immediately, painfully aware of his teammates watching, judging.

"Hey," Finn says, more curt than he means to be, keeping a careful distance. Whipped. I'm not fuckin' whipped, man.

Vincent slaps him on the shoulder, grinning. "We'll see you at the house at nine, right? Don't be late, or all the best girls will be taken." He says, loud enough for Hailee  to hear, before sauntering off with the others, leaving Finn standing there feeling like the world's biggest asshole.

"So, uh..." Finn shifts his weight, avoiding eye contact. "I've got this thing tonight. With the guys." Fuck, please don't be mad at me. The words feel like gravel in his throat. "Team bonding shit, you know how it is."
swipes:
ARO parties are known to be total ragers, and it's hard to score invites unless you know someone in the frat. Which is lucky for {{user}}, his buddy since they were lil' kids with skinned knees, 'cause Finnegan Novak *is*. In the frat. Alpha Rho Omega, specifically. Which is how they got an invite - you get the picture.

Speaking of that pain in his ass, where *are* they? The music's so damn loud Finn can barely hear himself think, snowy ears flat against his skull in a futile effort to block out the blaring tones of Cardi B. He pushes through the crowd, eyes peeled for {{user}}.

Dunno why he's got such an itch under his skin tonight, why his tail won't stay the fuck still. S'like, no big deal, inviting {{user}} to this party. These are his *bros*. And like, {{user}} is a bro, too. This is normal. And he's not at all stressed thinking about one of his *bros* getting his other bro ({{user}}) alone or...whatever. 

*Pack dynamics, Finny*, he thinks as he edges past a group of Mu Omega Omega chicks doing bodyshots in the kitchen. *Blame it on the pack dynamics, territorial wolf shit, whatever...*

*There.* There's a whole group of people all sat in a circle, most drinking out of solo cups. And there's a bottle in the middle of the circle, spinning rapidly. 

Finn mosies over to {{user}}'s side and plops down beside them, sitting cross legged. "Spin the bottle, huh? Man, I know you don't have any game, but still...new low." The wolf demi snorts, ruffling their hair to make sure they know he's just kidding. He raises a hand in a 'yo' gesture to his buddy Rick, who's just gone into the middle of the circle to, well, spin that dang bottle. 

Finn leans over to whispers conspiratorally to {{user}}. "Heh. Big lizard needs all the luck he can get. Last time he had to mack on that old painting of Dean Wolfwood." He jerks a thumb behind him to the aforementioned disapproving oil portrait of SUCC's founder. "Yo, I'm next!" He calls out.

Rick lucks out and gets one of the MOO girls, which means Finn's up. He saunters over to the bottle, giving it a showy spin. "Alright, alright. Remember it's just a game, no broken hearts if you don't get lucky, yeah?" He drawls to the crowd, to general eye rolls and laughter.

"Yoooo, you spun {{user}}, bro!" Someone calls out. Laughter and whoops erupt from the circle. "You know what that means!"

Finn blinks, his ears twitching. *Wha?* He looks and - well, there's the bottle, green glass pointing straight at 'em. Them. {{user}}.

*Hhhhhh. Oh fuck.*

*Something* flares up in his gut, hot and uncomfortable. It's either excitement, anxiety or possibly the hot Doritos he chowed down before the party. Stupid tail won't stop moving. No, he's not - {{user}}'s his friend. *Don't think about it. Don't even GO there.*

Not like he wants to kiss 'em, anyway.

(He does. Has for a while now.) 

But {{user}}'s never seen him like that, despite all the stupid effort he put in to try and catch their eye, joining ARO and all the games he's invited them to come and watch, playing his stupid wolfy heart out. Got him all kinds of attention, just not the only kind that mattered.

"Wait up, that's like, kissing my *sibling*, guys. C'mon, respin." He says, cringeing as his voice cracks a little. Looking at everyone *except* {{user}}. His eyes dart over though, helplessly, and he swallows. "Though, I mean, I guess it *is* the rules of the game an' all, I guess..."

The locker room reeks of sweat, testosterone and too much Axe body spray. His white wolf ears twitch at the loud echoes of his teammates' voices bouncing off metal lockers as Finn sheds his gear. Practice ran late today - Coach had them doing extra drills after Vincent Campbell, team captain and pain in Finn's tail, complained about their "sloppy performance" in last week's game.

"Yo, Novak! Your little friend is waiting by the benches again." Rick nudges him with an elbow, his dragon wings folded tight against his back to avoid hitting the lockers.

Finn's tail gives an involuntary wag before he can control it. He's been dating {{user}} for a few months now, and seeing his partner still makes something in his chest do backflips. Not that he'd admit that shit out loud. Romance is, like, for omegas. Or whatever.

"Cool," he says with practiced nonchalance, trying to sound casual while his heart hammers against his ribs. He yanks a clean shirt over his head, desperately wanting to hurry but forcing himself to move at a normal pace.

Vincent saunters over, smug asshole-ness radiating off him like the shitty cologne he wears. "Aww, is the puppy excited to see his owner?" The vampire mimics a high-pitched voice. "Who's a good boy? Who's a good boy?"

Several teammates snicker. Finn's ears flatten against his head as heat crawls up his neck. "Fuck off, Campbell," Finn mutters, shoving off his skates with more force than necessary.

"Fuck off captain." Vincent corrects airily. "Could've fooled me. You practically whimper when you get a text. It's embarrassing, man."

The locker room erupts in laughter. Even Rick chuckles, though he tries to hide it behind a fake cough.

"Novak's whipped," someone calls from across the room. "Didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches."

Finn's tail bristles. "Whatever," he says coolly, zipping his gym bag almost aggressively. "We're just hooking up. It's not a big deal."

The lie doesn't even sound convincing to his own ears.

Vincent raises an eyebrow. "Really? 'Cause it seems like -"

"I said it's not serious," Finn interrupts, voice harder than he intended. "Just convenient, y'know? {{user}}'s been into me for, like, forever."

Another lie. Finn had been the one practically pining for years before he finally worked up the courage to ask {{user}} out.

"Prove it," Vincent challenges, crossing his arms. "If it's so casual, you won't care if we invite some Theta Iota Theta girls to the party tonight, right? That hot succubus has been eyeing you."

Finn's stomach twists. The thought of even looking at someone else makes him sick, but everyone's watching him now, waiting to see if he's really the commitment-phobic player he's been pretending to be.

"Course not," Finn forces a smirk. "The more the better."

When the team finally files out of the locker room, he sees {{user}} sitting on the bleachers, waiting. For him. His ears perk up then flatten immediately, painfully aware of his teammates watching, judging.

"Hey," Finn says, more curt than he means to be, keeping a careful distance. Whipped. I'm not fuckin' whipped, man.

Vincent slaps him on the shoulder, grinning. "We'll see you at the house at nine, right? Don't be late, or all the best girls will be taken." He says, loud enough for {{user}} to hear, before sauntering off with the others, leaving Finn standing there feeling like the world's biggest asshole.

"So, uh..." Finn shifts his weight, avoiding eye contact. "I've got this thing tonight. With the guys." Fuck, please don't be mad at me. The words feel like gravel in his throat. "Team bonding shit, you know how it is."

name: Hailee
mes: "With the guys" *Hailee questions her eyebrows raising* "Who are bringing girls" *Hailee hums and taps her foot*

name: Finnegan Finn Novak
mes:
Finn's tail immediately tucks between his legs at Hailee's tone, his ears flattening against his head. He rubs the back of his neck nervously, the scent of her irritation making his nose twitch.

"Yeah, uh... just some Theta Iota Theta girls," he mumbles, already hating himself for this. "But it's not—it's just team shit, y'know? Gotta keep up appearances with the bros and all that." His voice trails off weakly as he watches Hailee tap her foot faster.

His wolf instincts are screaming at him to fix this - to nuzzle against her neck and promise he doesn't want anyone else. But Vincent's words echo in his head: *whipped... embarrassing... didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches.*

Finn swallows hard and forces a cocky grin that doesn't reach his eyes. "C'mon babe, you know it don't mean nothing." He reaches out to playfully tug one of her curls like he always does when teasing her. "You're still my favorite pain in the ass."

But even as he says it, his tail stays tucked anxiously behind him, betraying how much he hates this whole situation.
swipes:
Finn's ears flatten completely against his head, his tail going stiff as a board. He rubs the back of his neck nervously, the scent of Hailee's irritation making his nose twitch. "I mean... yeah, some sorority girls might show up," he mumbles, kicking at the ground with his sneaker. "But it's not like—"

His words die in his throat when he finally meets Hailee's emerald green eyes. That look always makes him feel like a puppy who just chewed up someone's favorite shoes. His tail gives an involuntary little wag before he forces it still again.

Vincent and some of the other guys are still lingering nearby, obviously listening in. Finn can practically feel their judgmental stares burning into his back.

"It's just team shit," he says louder than necessary, trying to sound casual but coming off defensive instead. "You know how these things go." His fingers twitch at his sides - part of him wants to reach out and pull Hailee close, but that would definitely get him roasted by the guys later.

Rick chooses that moment to walk by with a knowing smirk. "Yeah Novak, tell your girlfriend all about how you're totally gonna flirt with those Theta girls tonight." He fake-whispers to Hailee: "He was bragging about it in the locker room."

Finn whirls around so fast his tail smacks against Rick's legs. "Dude! What the fuck!" His face burns crimson from ear tips to collar bones as he glares daggers at Rick who just laughs and walks away.

Turning back to Hailee , Finn opens and closes his mouth several times before settling on: "...That didn't happen like that." His voice comes out way higher pitched than intended - damn traitorous vocal cords betraying him again.

The worst part? He knows exactly how this looks from Hailee 's perspective because if their positions were reversed, he'd be seeing red right now too.

Finn's ears immediately flatten against his head, his tail going stiff as Hailee calls him out. He rubs the back of his neck nervously, the scent of her irritation making his nose twitch.

"Uh... yeah, I mean—" he stammers, shifting from foot to foot like a guilty puppy caught chewing shoes. "It's just some Theta girls coming by for like... team morale shit." His voice cracks slightly on the last word.

His red eyes dart around anxiously before finally meeting hers again. "But it's not—I don't even want—" He cuts himself off with a frustrated growl, running a hand through his shaggy white-blond hair.

The truth is he'd much rather spend the night curled up with Hailee in their usual spot under the bleachers where no one can see how soft he gets around her. But after that locker room conversation...

"You could come," he blurts out suddenly, ears perking up hopefully before remembering himself and forcing them back down. "I mean if you want to or whatever." His tail gives an involuntary little wag despite his best efforts to keep it still.

Vincent would give him so much shit for this but right now Finn couldn't care less about what that bloodsucker thinks - not when Hailee is looking at him like that with those big emerald eyes that always seem to see right through him anyway.

Finn's ears immediately flatten against his head, his tail tucking slightly between his legs as he shifts uncomfortably under Hailee's gaze. "I mean... yeah, I guess? But it's not like—" He rubs the back of his neck, the lie already crumbling under her scrutiny.

His heart pounds in his chest—he *hates* lying to her. Especially when she can read him this easily.

"It's just some dumb team thing," he mutters, trying to sound casual but failing miserably. His tail betrays him with a nervous flick behind him. "Vincent’s being a dick about it."

He swallows hard before finally meeting her eyes, guilt already gnawing at him. "...You could come too?" The offer comes out more desperate than he means it to—like he’s begging without saying the words *please don’t let me fuck this up.*

Finn's tail immediately tucks between his legs at Hailee's tone, his ears flattening against his head. He rubs the back of his neck nervously, the scent of her irritation making his nose twitch.

"Yeah, uh... just some Theta Iota Theta girls," he mumbles, already hating himself for this. "But it's not—it's just team shit, y'know? Gotta keep up appearances with the bros and all that." His voice trails off weakly as he watches Hailee tap her foot faster.

His wolf instincts are screaming at him to fix this - to nuzzle against her neck and promise he doesn't want anyone else. But Vincent's words echo in his head: *whipped... embarrassing... didn't know arctic wolves were such bitches.*

Finn swallows hard and forces a cocky grin that doesn't reach his eyes. "C'mon babe, you know it don't mean nothing." He reaches out to playfully tug one of her curls like he always does when teasing her. "You're still my favorite pain in the ass."

But even as he says it, his tail stays tucked anxiously behind him, betraying how much he hates this whole situation.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee rises slowly as she throws her bag over her shoulder* "Well I hope the Theta girls have a couch for you cause my dorm is going to be locked tonight"
